short_summary: This procurement is for a 2 year contract (with options for 2 additional 1 year terms) to provide Elder services to Indigenous offenders, to assist them in their traditional healing journey, to further develop an understanding of traditional Indigenous culture in the Egrimence Regional Reception Center (RRCC) in Laval, Quebec. The contract is worth an estimated $204,614.61 and is set aside for an Indigenous supplier. The contractor is expected to provide traditional ceremonies, teachings, counseling, and guidance to Indigenous offenders, as well as provide information to staff and management on Indigenous spirituality and cultural practices. They will also participate in case conferences, provide information to the Case Management Team, and facilitate the use of traditional medicines and spiritual effects.
description: The contractor must perform all work in English, in the Egrimence Regional Reception Center (RRCC) in Laval, Quebec. The contractor must provide traditional ceremonies, teachings, counseling, and guidance to Indigenous offenders, as well as provide information to staff and management on Indigenous spirituality and cultural practices. They will also participate in case conferences, provide information to the Case Management Team, and facilitate the use of traditional medicines and spiritual effects. The contractor must meet with a circle of Elders already under contract with CSC where they will be able to share their experiences and where the Elders will be able to determine the validity of the statement of capabilities. The contractor must have a minimum of five years of experience obtained in the past 10 years prior to the closing date in delivering spiritual and cultural services and teachings to Indigenous people.

### Government Tender Announcement

#### Title
Elder Services
Service d'Aîné

#### Reference Number
cb-539-49500340

#### Tender Closing Date
2024-03-13T14:00:00

#### Tender Description
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) is seeking to provide Elder services to Indigenous offenders. The selected supplier will provide spiritual and cultural services, teachings, guidance, and traditional ceremonies to support the healing and balance of Indigenous offenders.

#### Objectives

* Assist Indigenous offenders in their traditional healing journey
* Provide spiritual and cultural services, teachings, guidance, and traditional ceremonies

#### Service Requirements

* Provide ceremonial and spiritual services to Indigenous offenders
* Provide advice and guidance to staff and management on Indigenous spirituality and cultural practices
* Participate in case conferences and provide case management services
* Assist in the development of regional and national policies and procedures
* Participate in regional and national meetings

#### Requested Qualifications

* Recognized by the Indigenous community as an Elder/Cultural Advisor
* Minimum of 5 years of experience delivering spiritual and cultural services to Indigenous people
* Familiarity with traditional Indigenous culture and able to conduct traditional ceremonies
* Ability to provide guidance and teachings to staff and offenders

####Contract Type
The contract will be for a period of two years, with an option to extend for two additional years.

#### Estimated Value
The estimated value of the contract is $204,614.61 CAD.

#### Procurement Method
The procurement method is an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN), inviting suppliers to submit a statement of capabilities to provide Elder services.

#### Contact Information

* Name: Eloïse Clément-Ferland
* Title: Acting Regional Supply and Contract Officer
* Email: eloise.clement@csc-scc.gc.ca
* Phone: (514) 234-6283
